items.title: 'Simply extraordinary' - Van der Poel wins eighth cyclo-cross Worlds
items.summary: Dutch cycling star Mathieu van der Poel sets a new record as he wins an eighth world cyclo-cross title at Hulst in the Netherlands.

items.title: Saint-Maximin leaves club over racist abuse of his children
items.summary: Former Newcastle United winger Allan Saint-Maximin leaves Mexican side Club America by mutual consent after saying his children were the victims of racist abuse.

items.title: This tiny pocket-friendly e-reader is packed with frustration and potential
items.summary: I've used and reviewed dozens of e-readers over the years, but the 5-inch Kobo Mini remains my favorite for one simple reason: It was small. items.title: Galaxy A37, A57 renders, S26 prices leak, Realme P4 Power official, Week 5 in review
items.summary: The Samsung Galaxy A37 and A57 are coming soon, though we don't know when exactly. But their official-looking renders have given us their design and hint at their specs. The A57 will measure 6.9mm and weigh 182 grams - both slimmer and lighter than the A56. Upfront, it packs a 6.6-inch TCL SCOT fleâ€¦

items.title: Asus ROG Strix GS-BE18000 Wi-Fi 7 gaming router â€” Good overall performance and a wealth of LAN ports
items.summary: The Asus ROG Strix GS-BE18000 hits all the right notes when it comes to hardware and software, and brings the performance to back it up on the 6 GHz and 5 GHz bands.

items.title: Watford boss Gracia resigns after three months
items.summary: Javi Gracia resigns as Watford manager after just over three months in job.

items.title: Researcher builds bizarre 128-byte USB drive the size of a dinner plate using ancient pre-semiconductor magnetic core memory technology â€” data disappears once it is read, requiring special handling
items.summary: A computing enthusiast has assembled one of the most bizarre low-capacity USB drives we have ever seen.

items.title: 'My son' - Chelsea and Strasbourg in talks to swap defenders
items.summary: Chelsea are in talks to recall Mamadou Sarr from Strasbourg, with Aaron Anselmino expected to move in the opposite direction.

items.title: Disney, NFL Close Deal That Makes League Partial Owner in ESPN
items.summary: The next time the NFL doesnâ€™t like the way ESPN covers the league, its executives can go right to the boss â€” by looking in the mirror. The Disney sports-media giant and the massive professional football league confirmed late Saturday that they had closed a deal that makes the NFL a minority stakehoâ€¦

items.title: Open source IDE-ATAPI drive emulator launches for vintage computers â€” drop-in 3.5-inch bay solution can save oodles of optical and HDD images to a microSD
items.summary: PicoIDE is touted as 'an open source IDE/ATAPI drive emulator for vintage computers.'

items.title: The telephoto is the only phone camera that really matters
items.summary: This is The Stepback, a weekly newsletter breaking down one essential story from the tech world. For more on Android phones, follow Dominic Preston. The Stepback arrives in our subscribers' inboxes at 8AM ET. Opt in for The Stepback here. How it started Samsung's Galaxy S20 Ultra wasn't the first pâ€¦

items.title: Moment Alcaraz beat Djokovic to complete career Grand Slam
items.summary: Watch the moment Carlos Alcaraz beats Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final to claim his seventh major title, becoming the youngest man to win a career Grand Slam.

items.title: Intel ties AMD for most reliable CPUs in 2025 system builder report â€” Nvidia's Founders Edition GPUs dominate with the lowest failure rates
items.summary: Puget System just released its annual reliability report for 2025, noting which computer components suffered the least number of failures in testing and deployment.

items.title: Rose hits birdie on 18th to inch towards PGA Tour win
items.summary: Watch England's Justin Rose surge into a six-shot lead with a birdie on the 18th hole, as he looks to secure a 13th PGA Tour win with a victory at the Farmers Insurance Open.

items.title: Oppo Reno16 series details leak
items.summary: The Reno15 series launched in China in November, and has recently started rolling out in other markets, but Oppo is already working on the Reno16 devices. According to a new leak by the prolific Digital Chat Station on Weibo, all members of the Reno16 family (in China) will have a 200MP main cameraâ€¦

items.title: Malicious OpenClaw â€˜skillâ€™ targets crypto users on ClawHub â€” 14 malicious skills were uploaded to ClawHub last month
items.summary: Security researchers are warning that the growing ecosystem around â€˜OpenClaw,â€™ the self-hosted AI assistant formerly known as Clawdbot, has already become a target for malware distribution.

items.title: The Intel 286 CPU was introduced on this day in 1982 â€” 16-bit x86 chip introduced protected mode memory, and would power the IBM PC/AT and a tidal wave of clones
items.summary: Today, in 1982, Intel introduced its â€œshowstoppingâ€ 80286 processor. This 16-bit fully x86 software compatible CPU delivered some major performance and architectural advancements over the 8086 and 8088, and would continue to be produced and feature in PC systems well into the 1990s.

items.title: Japanese art museum intros $15 bookmarks made from PCBs â€” the PCB traces form a miniature Tokyo Metro map
items.summary: The Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum has added some beautiful PCB Metro Map bookmarks to its souvenir store.

items.title: Scotland beat USA to clinch T20 World Cup place
items.summary: Scotland book their place at the Women's T20 World Cup with a comfortable 41-run win over the United States in the final Super Six qualification game in Nepal.

items.title: Miller hairpiece punched off during fight
items.summary: In an unusual moment on the undercard of a title fight between Shakur Stevenson and Teofimo Lopez, American Jarrell Miller threw his toupee into the crowd after it was dislodged late in the second round.

items.title: 'Spooky premonitions' drive unfancied Kelly to top of boxing mountain
items.summary: Josh Kelly says he was getting "spooky" premonitions during fight week prior to beating Bakhram Murtazaliev for the IBF light-middleweight title.

items.title: Stevenson wins fourth world title and calls out Benn
items.summary: American Shakur Stevenson dominates Teofimo Lopez to secure the WBO light-welterweight belt by unanimous decision at Madison Square Garden.

items.title: Liverpool in talks over Sunderland loanee Geertruida
items.summary: Liverpool are in talks to sign Dutch defender Lutsharel Geertruida on loan.

items.title: Weekly poll: how important is magnetic wireless charging to you?
items.summary: Apple introduced MagSafe wireless charging in 2020 with the iPhone 12 series. In contrast to regular wireless charging, it uses magnets rather than relying on manual alignment between the charging coils or on gravity to keep the phone and charger together. It is a simple, cheap and effective solutiâ€¦
